DataElement.preferredName: Soft Tissue Sarcoma Cancer American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Pathologic Regional Lymph Node N Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the regional lymph node involvement for the soft tissue sarcoma based on evidence obtained from pathologic examination through completion of definitive surgery.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the pathologic N stage of a sarcoma.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A usually aggressive malignant mesenchymal cell tumor most commonly arising from muscle, fat, fibrous tissue, bone, cartilage, and blood vessels.  Sarcomas occur in both children and adults.  The prognosis depends largely on the degree of differentiation (grade) of the tumor.  Representative subtypes are liposarcoma, leiomyosarcoma, osteosarcoma, and chondrosarcoma. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A usually aggressive malignant neoplasm of the soft tissue or bone. It arises from muscle, fat, fibrous tissue, bone, cartilage, and blood vessels. Sarcomas occur in both children and adults. The prognosis depends largely on the degree of differentiation (grade) of the neoplasm. Representative subtypes are liposarcoma, leiomyosarcoma, osteosarcoma, and chondrosarcoma.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pathologic; caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:One criteria of the TMN staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

Concepts.definition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 3-29-19 Received permission from Brian Campbell to transfer DEC ownership from CTEP to NCI Standards; tmt.  Updated to use Property based on NCIt concepts

ValueDomain.preferredName: Soft Tissue Sarcoma American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 N Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A finding about one or more characteristics of soft tissue sarcoma, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system.  Kaposi sarcoma, fibromatosis (desmoid tumor), and sarcoma arising from the dura mater, brain, parenchymatous organs, or hollow viscera are not included in this classification. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)_A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement._The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Soft Tissue Sarcoma pN0 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Soft Tissue Sarcoma pN0 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Soft tissue sarcoma without regional lymph node metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Soft Tissue Sarcoma pN0 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Soft tissue sarcoma without regional lymph node metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Soft Tissue Sarcoma pN1 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Soft Tissue Sarcoma pN1 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Soft tissue sarcoma with regional lymph node metastasis.  Note: Presence of positive nodes (N1) in M0 tumors is considered Stage III. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Soft Tissue Sarcoma pN1 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Soft tissue sarcoma with regional lymph node metastasis.  Note: Presence of positive nodes (N1) in M0 tumors is considered Stage III. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Soft Tissue Sarcoma pNX TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Soft Tissue Sarcoma pNX TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Soft tissue sarcoma in which regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed.  (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Soft Tissue Sarcoma pNX TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Soft tissue sarcoma in which regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed.  (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

Kaposi sarcoma, fibromatosis (desmoid tumor), and sarcoma arising from the dura mater, brain, parenchymatous organs, or hollow viscera are not included in this classification. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

The extent of a cancer in the body.
